required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicenter Study to Evaluate the ROX Anastomotic Coupler System (ACS) In Patients With Severe Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Non-Randomized, Open Label, Multi-Center Study to Evaluate the ROX Anastomotic Coupler System (ACS) in Patients With Severe Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and performance of the ROX Anastomotic Coupler System (ACS) in patients with severe hypertension.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Change in mean office SBP at six months as compared to Baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in mean office DBP six months as compared to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in mean office DBP at six months as compared to Baseline

arm_group.description: ROX Anastomic Coupler System (ACS) + continuing standard antihypertensive medications

intervention.description: The ROX Anastomic Coupler (ACS) will be used to create an arteriovenous fistula in the iliac region (between the iliac artery and vein).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of severe hypertension must be made on the basis of current findings, medical history, and physical examination
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any serious medical condition that may adversely affect the patient's safety, limit the subject's ability to participate in the study, comply with follow-up requirements or impact the scientific integrity of the study.
